intro: Chelonanthus albus, commonly known as the white chelonanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and India. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its flowers are usually arranged in racemes and bloom in the spring. The fruit is a capsule that releases small, winged seeds when mature.
